info.description: With the PureCloud Platform API, you can control all aspects of your PureCloud environment. With the APIs you can access the system configuration, manage conversations and more.
info.title: PureCloud Platform API

get.summary: Get the members of a chat conversation.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of entries to return per page, or omitted for the default.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to return, or omitted for the first page.

parameters.name: excludeDisconnectedMembers
parameters.description: If true, the results will not contain members who have a DISCONNECTED state.

post.summary: Create an ACD chat conversation from an external customer.
post.description:
This endpoint will create a new ACD Chat conversation under the specified Chat Deployment.
 The conversation will begin with a guest member in it (with a role=CUSTOMER) according to the customer information that is supplied. If the guest member is authenticated, the 'memberAuthToken' field should include his JWT as generated by the 'POST /api/v2/signeddata' resource; if the guest member is anonymous (and the Deployment permits it) this field can be omitted.
 The returned data includes the IDs of the conversation created, along with a newly-create JWT token that you can supply to all future endpoints as authentication to perform operations against that conversation. After successfully creating a conversation, you should connect a websocket to the event stream named in the 'eventStreamUri' field of the response; the conversation is not routed until the event stream is attached.

get.summary: Get the messages of a chat conversation.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: If available, get the messages chronologically after the id of this message

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: If available, get the messages chronologically before the id of this message

parameters.name: maxResults

displayName.description: The display name of the member.

firstName.description: The first name of the member.

lastName.description: The last name of the member.

email.description: The email address of the member.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the member.

avatarImageUrl.description: The url to the avatar image of the member.

role.description: The role of the member, one of [agent, customer, acd, workflow]

joinDate.description: The time the member joined the conversation. Date time is represented as an ISO-8601 string. For example: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss[.mmm]Z

leaveDate.description: The time the member left the conversation, or null if the member is still active in the conversation. Date time is represented as an ISO-8601 string. For example: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss[.mmm]Z

authenticatedGuest.description: If true, the guest member is an authenticated guest.

customFields.description: Any custom fields of information pertaining to this member.

state.description: The connection state of this member.

id.description: The globally unique identifier for the object.

types.description: The types of media being requested.

state.description: The state of the media request, one of PENDING|ACCEPTED|DECLINED|TIMEDOUT|CANCELLED|ERRORED.

communicationId.description: The ID of the new media communication, if applicable.

securityKey.description: The security information related to a media request.

WebChatGuestMediaRequest.description: Object representing the guest model of a media request of a chat conversation.

deploymentId.description: The web chat Deployment ID which contains the appropriate settings for this chat conversation.

routingTarget.description: The routing information to use for the new chat conversation.

memberInfo.description: The guest member info to use for the new chat conversation.

memberAuthToken.description: If the guest member is an authenticated member (ie, not anonymous) his JWT is provided here. The token will have been previously generated with the "POST /api/v2/signeddata" resource.

journeyContext.description: A subset of the Journey System's data relevant to this conversation/session request (for external linkage and internal usage/context).

targetType.description: The target type of the routing target, such as 'QUEUE'.

targetAddress.description: The target of the route, in the format appropriate given the 'targetType'.

skills.description: The list of skill names to use for routing.

language.description: The language name to use for routing.

priority.description: The priority to assign to the conversation for routing.

displayName.description: The display name to use for the guest member in the conversation.

firstName.description: The first name to use for the guest member in the conversation.

lastName.description: The last name to use for the guest member in the conversation.

email.description: The email address to use for the guest member in the conversation.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number to use for the guest member in the conversation.

avatarImageUrl.description: The URL to the avatar image to use for the guest member in the conversation, if any.

customFields.description: Any custom fields of information, in key-value format, to attach to the guest member in the conversation.

customer.description: A subset of the Journey System's customer data at a point-in-time (for external linkage and internal usage/context)

customerSession.description: A subset of the Journey System's tracked customer session data at a point-in-time (for external linkage and internal usage/context)

triggeringAction.description: A subset of the Journey System's action data relevant to a part of a conversation (for external linkage and internal usage/context)

id.description: An ID of a customer within the Journey System at a point-in-time.  Note that a customer entity can have multiple customerIds based on the stitching process.  Depending on the context within the PureCloud conversation, this may or may not be mutable.

idType.description: The type of the customerId within the Journey System (e.g. cookie).

id.description: An ID of a Customer/User's session within the Journey System at a point-in-time

type.description: The type of the Customer/User's session within the Journey System (e.g. web, app)

id.description: The ID of an action from the Journey System (an action is spawned from an actionMap)

actionMap.description: Details about the action map from the Journey System which triggered this action

id.description: The ID of the actionMap in the Journey System which triggered this action

version.description: The version number of the actionMap in the Journey System at the time this action was triggered

jwt.description: The JWT that you can use to identify subsequent calls on this conversation

eventStreamUri.description: The URI which provides the conversation event stream.

id.description: The event identifier of this typing indicator event (useful to guard against event re-delivery

sender.description: The member who sent the message

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the message, in ISO-8601 format

id.description: The globally unique identifier for the object.

body.description: The message body. Note that message bodies are limited to 4,000 characters.

bodyType.description: The purpose of the message within the conversation, such as a standard text entry versus a greeting.

id.description: The globally unique identifier for the object.

sender.description: The member who sent the message

bodyType.description: The purpose of the message within the conversation, such as a standard text entry versus a greeting.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the message, in ISO-8601 format

400.description: The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax.

401.description: No authentication bearer token specified in authorization header.

403.description: You are not authorized to perform the requested action.

404.description: The requested resource was not found.

413.description: The request is over the size limit. Content-Length: %s

415.description: Unsupported Media Type - Unsupported or incorrect media type, such as an incorrect Content-Type value in the header.

429.description: Rate limit exceeded the maximum [%s] requests within [%s] seconds

500.description: The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request.

503.description: Service Unavailable - The server is currently unavailable (because it is overloaded or down for maintenance).
